intro: Daviesia chordophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed broom. It is a flowering plant native to southern Australia, characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and distinctive, narrow, leathery leaves. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow flowers, which bloom in spring and attract a variety of pollinators. It is well adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in heathlands and open forests. Daviesia chordophylla is a member of the legume family and has a deep root system that helps it survive in arid conditions.
